section.p: kcaldav is a simple, safe, and minimal CalDav server depending only on kcgi(3) and expat(3). The ISO C source code is ISC licensed. For the time being, it works only for simple setups, for example, a calendar collection shared between Mozilla Lightning, Mac OS X iCal, and iOS7 (iPhone4) clients. It compiles and runs on OpenBSD, Linux, and Mac OS X. Setting up kcaldav is bumpy because each system will have different requirements (user directories, full-system, virtual hosts, etc.). The Makefile contains a number of examples. To begin within, download the sources and verify the fingerprint.

ol.li: Install dependencies kcgi(3), expat(3) (usually part of the operating system), and bsd(3) if using Linux. kcaldav and kcgi(3) are often developed in tandem, so make sure you're up to date with both.

Configure for your installation by editing the Makefile: CALDIR to the calendar root within CGI script's file-system, LIBS and STATIC (per-system defaults are noted), CGIPREFIX to the CGI script install target, CALPREFIX to the CGI's data file install target, HTDOCSPREFIX to the web server's static files install target, and HTDOCS to the static files' URI. All of these are documented and given sample values.
Compile with make, install manpages and administration tools with make install, then install the CGI script and its data files with make installcgi.

If using Apache, make sure that HTTP authorisation is not interpreted by the web server. You'll probably need a re-write rule, e.g., [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%{HTTP:Authorization},L]. OpenBSD's httpd(8) doesn't need this. I'm not sure about nginx.

section.p: To use kcaldav, consult the kcaldav(8) manual. You'll also want to read kcaldav.passwd(1). If these manpages lack information or clarity, that's a bug. For bug-reports and comments on usage (please let me know!), contact Kristaps.
